messages.subject: unschooling questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/4/2003 9:23:04 AM Central Daylight Time, ... I also wanted to add that gaps in knowledge are part of being human. There is NO way that
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/4/2003 9:23:04 AM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Every kid who's ever gone to school has gaps. People learn to close the
> gaps when they have a need to do so.

I also wanted to add that "gaps" in knowledge are part of being human. There
is NO way that anyone is going to know about everything, so I guess we're all
doomed to have these gaps as long as we're living.:)
It's the gaps that make life interesting, that keep our curiosity alive and
make us ask questions. Gaps are a GOOD thing.

Can't remember who said it but there is a quote I love: "there is nothing
that everyone needs to know"

Ren


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
